  • Description: SequenceEvent: During the out bound load the drum was placed on the belt. it fell off the belt and the lid seal were damaged causing a leak. DescribePack: the lid and the rubber seal are no longer sealed. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The drum was put into a hazmat tote and the into the cage.

item.title: Report E-2023090048
item.description:
Report E-2023090048

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-07T15:11:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-22
  • City: MILWAUKEE
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On August 22, 2023, one (1) 5-gallon pail of printer ink was damaged in a load shift and released approximately one (1) pint of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted surfaces. HCE personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted trailer and utilized hand tools to collect all printer ink-impacted materials and the damaged pail in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal by R+L.

item.title: Report E-2023080998
item.description:
Report E-2023080998

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-07T15:11:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-17
  • City: MILWAUKEE
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On August 17, 2023, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN1193 was punctured by a nail and released approximately less than one (<1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from SET Environmental (SET) to remediate the impacted site. SET personnel deployed absorbents and degreaser to the impacted trailer and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum. SET personnel placed the damaged 55-gallon drum into a 95-gallon drum. Both containers were staged onsite for disposal by R+L.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that one of the poly 50 pound bags of parcure 305 (un3087) had been torn open by a sharp object and had released one pound of product. Contractors were dispatched for the containment and cleanup of the release.

item.title: Report X-2023080362
item.description:
Report X-2023080362

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-06T15:11:55+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-11
  • City: OAK CREEK
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER WAS CALLED TO SPILAGE AND ITEM WAS TAKEN TO THE DMP FOR INSPECTION. DURING INSPECTION RESPONDER DISCOVERED NON-REGULATED ITEM LEAKED. RESPONDER ALSO DISCOVERED, UPON OPENING THE BOX, PACKAGE CONTAINED AERESOLS AND WASNT MARKED WITH LIMITED QUANTITY ON THE OUTSIDE. THE RMP WAS NOTIFIED, CALLED THE HAZMATS HELP DESK.

item.title: Report X-2023080360
item.description:
Report X-2023080360

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-06T15:11:55+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-11
  • City: OAK CREEK
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: PACKAGE WAS LEAKED ON BY ANOTHER PACKAGED AND 2 AEROSOL CANS WERE DISCOVERED INSIDE BOX, DURING CLEAN UP, WITH NO MARKING ON THE OUTSIDE. RESPONDER CALLED HELP DESK, CONFIRMED IT TO BE AN UNDECLARED.
